When global tech giant IBM introduced its Watson platform to the world in 2015, many investors believed that this was going to be the future of the computing industry. Their shares skyrocketed immediately, and many who had invested in the company made a fortune. However, as time passed, it became increasingly evident that AI technology still had a long way to go before it could live up to its many promises.

This is the story of AI hype in the stock market. It is a tale of massive profits, followed by massive losses, as investors learn the hard way that betting on untested technology can be incredibly risky. Despite this, AI stocks have continued to gain in popularity, with many investors eager to get in on the next big thing.
https://akash.mittal.blog/web3/2023/6/1/AI-Hype-Stock-The-Hidden-Risks-Lurking-in-Your-Portfolio.html

Years ago, I had a professor who was very particular about proper citation. He would often say, "Citation is not just about avoiding plagiarism. It's about acknowledging the ideas and hard work of others. It's about being a responsible member of the academic community."
Fast forward to today, AI has come a long way in generating citations. One of the most popular citation generators is ChatGPT. It claims that it can generate high-quality citations in seconds. However, how accurate is it?
Firstly, ChatGPT sometimes fails to recognize the correct author of the source. I tested it with an article by Jane Smith from the New York Times. Instead of citing Smith, ChatGPT cited the publication as the author.
Secondly, ChatGPT sometimes doesn't cite the correct year of publication. For example, when I inputted an article from 2010, it cited it as being published in 2011.
Thirdly, ChatGPT sometimes cites the wrong page numbers. When I submitted an article that had 12 total pages, ChatGPT cited only the first six pages.
https://akash.mittal.blog/web3/2023/6/1/AI-s-Errors-and-Successes-in-Generating-Citations.html
#trending #AI #citations #ChatGPT #errors #successes

Imagine you receive a message from an old friend on Facebook Messenger. They send you a link to a cool new ChatGPT app that allows you to chat with an AI-powered language model that can understand natural language. Excited to try it out, you click on the link and download the app to your phone.
After a few days of chatting with ChatGPT, you start to notice that the app is suggesting products and services that are eerily similar to your recent online searches. You start to wonder, is ChatGPT really safe to use? Can it be trusted with your personal information?
According to a recent study, there are over 500,000 third-party Chrome extensions that can be downloaded from the Google Web Store. Many of these extensions are designed to streamline our online experiences, but some may also be putting our privacy at risk. For example:
Similarly, there are now hundreds of chat apps available for popular platforms like Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, and Slack. While many of these apps are legitimate and safe to use, some may be designed to steal user data or install malware on their devices.
The short answer is that it depends on the app or extension in question. While there are certainly some third-party tools that are safe and useful, there are also many that can cause serious security and privacy concerns. Some things to consider when evaluating the safety of a third-party app or extension include:

It was a bright Monday morning when Robin, a data scientist, logged onto her computer and saw the news of C3 AI's financial results for the fiscal fourth quarter and full year fiscal 2023. She was amazed to see the impressive figures and the growth the company had achieved in such a short time.
C3 AI, a leading enterprise AI software provider, reported $64.8 million in total revenue for the fourth quarter, a 54% increase year-over-year. The full year revenue was $217.2 million, up 40% year-over-year. The company also added 27 new customers during the quarter, bringing the total number of customers to 194.
Robin couldn't help but wonder how C3 AI was able to achieve such success in a year that was so full of challenges for most businesses. She decided to investigate further and found out some interesting facts.
One of the reasons for C3 AI's success was their ability to pivot and adapt to changing market conditions. By offering cloud-based solutions, they were able to meet the increasing demand for remote work and digital transformation. They also expanded their product portfolio to include solutions for supply chain optimization and predictive maintenance.
Another factor was their investment in talent. C3 AI hired top experts in the AI and data science industry, which helped them to deliver innovative solutions to their customers. They also invested heavily in training and development for their employees to ensure their continued growth and success.
https://akash.mittal.blog/web3/2023/6/1/C3-AI-Announces-Fiscal-Fourth-Quarter-and-Full-Year-Fiscal-2023-Financial-Results.html

However, as the tech industry becomes increasingly volatile, even established companies like C3.ai must navigate the challenges of maintaining growth and market share.

Furthermore, the challenges facing C3.ai and other AI startups may have broader implications for the tech industry as a whole. As AI and other emerging technologies become more central to business operations, it is crucial for these companies to maintain a strong foothold in the market. Without continued innovation and growth, the tech industry may stagnate, inhibiting progress and ultimately limiting the potential benefits of AI for enterprise customers.
Despite the challenges facing AI startups, there are several practical tips that can help these companies navigate the competitive landscape:

Once again, hype is not enough to keep a share price up, as C3 ai experienced its worst week since its IPO in December 2020.
Image Source: Unsplash
The artificial intelligence software company, C3 ai, was expected to continue its upward trajectory after reporting strong earnings in the previous quarters. However, that was not the case after the company's earnings outlook did not match market expectations, leading to a sharp decline in its stock price.
During the past week, the C3 ai share price suffered a significant drop of more than 20% after losing $6.5 billion in market value. The company reported disappointing guidance for the current quarter, citing longer sales cycles and tougher competition with well-established rivals as reasons for the lack of projected growth.
As a result, analysts have downgraded their recommendations on C3 ai's stock from a "buy" to a "hold" rating, while the company's management expressed disappointment in the market's reaction to the guidance, explaining that the softness in the current quarter was due to time delays, not lost deals.

Imagine waking up one day to a world where you could speak to your computer, and it would not only understand you but also anticipate your next move. This phenomenon is becoming increasingly popular with the advent of ChatGPT and Generative AI.
From the United States to China, and Europe to South America, the conversation about artificial intelligence as a solution to business challenges is thriving. ChatGPT is an AI language model used to generate coherent and articulate responses to written prompts, while generating AI is a broader category of AI technology that can be used to generate text, music, or images.
With the rise of AI-powered solutions, businesses have invested heavily in these technologies to become more efficient, create new revenue streams and improve the customer experience. Some of the AI-powered solutions that have emerged over the years include customer service chatbots that offer round-the-clock support, automating marketing tasks, and predictive analytics that help businesses make more informed decisions.
Chatbots using ChatGPT technology have become increasingly popular in optimizing customer service, especially for online businesses, where customers expect instant gratification and personalized service. ChatGPT technology enables businesses to customize customer service chatbots, enabling them to cater to specific customer needs accurately.
Furthermore, in the healthcare industry, ChatGPT technology is used to analyze clinical notes and accelerate scientific research, optimizing the efficiency and accuracy of medical diagnoses. In the finance sector, Chat GPT technology is also used to automate simple tasks such as account analysis and credit scoring. ChatGPT technology's promising applications have made it a critical player across industries, generating income and creating job opportunities.
https://akash.mittal.blog/web3/2023/6/1/ChatGPT-and-Generative-AI-Key-Opportunities-and-Hurdles-Worldwide.html

Back in the day, if you wanted to learn something new, you had to go to school or travel to attend courses and seminars. But with the advent of technology, traditional education has been overhauled, and education delivery has been revolutionized. One such technology is ChatGPT, a software program used to create chatbots that mimic conversations with humans.
In recent years, chatbots have become increasingly popular, and ChatGPT has emerged as a leading chatbot generation tool. For the education industry, ChatGPT has the potential to transform the way in which we teach and learn. Imagine being able to have a personalized conversation with a virtual tutor, or getting instant support and feedback on your academic progress. ChatGPT could make these scenarios a reality.
According to a survey carried out by the World Economic Forum, the adoption of AI in education is set to increase significantly, and chatbots are expected to play a major role in this transformation. In this article, we take a look at the impact of ChatGPT in education and how it is shaping the future of learning.
One of the significant ways in which ChatGPT has impacted education is through the creation of personalized learning experiences. With the help of technology, students can now access customized education programs that are tailored to their individual needs and learning styles.
ChatGPT has already made an impact in this area by creating chatbots that engage students in conversation, evaluate their progress, and provide personalized feedback. These chatbots can identify areas where a student might be struggling and offer help in real-time. Essentially, ChatGPT-based chatbots create an interactive experience that promotes active learning and can be more effective than traditional methods.
https://akash.mittal.blog/web3/2023/6/1/ChatGPT-and-the-Future-of-Education-A-Revolutionary-Impact.html

Once upon a time, a father was helping his daughter with her math homework. He was struggling to explain a concept, so he turned to his phone for assistance. He downloaded an app called ChatGPT, a conversational AI program that can answer any question. He asked the app to explain the concept to his daughter, and in a matter of seconds, the app had generated a clear and concise explanation that both the father and daughter could understand.
This scenario is becoming more and more common as AI technology continues to advance. And while it can be incredibly helpful, it's also important for parents to understand the potential risks and limitations of these technologies.
ChatGPT is just one example of the burgeoning AI technology that's becoming increasingly accessible to the general public. Other examples include voice-activated assistants like Siri and Alexa, automated financial advisors like Betterment, and self-driving cars from companies like Tesla.
These types of technologies can be incredibly helpful in certain situations. For example, a voice-activated assistant can help someone with physical disabilities to control their home environment. An automated financial advisor can help someone who's intimidated by the complexities of investing. And a self-driving car can help reduce the number of accidents caused by human error.
However, it's important to understand that these technologies are not perfect. For example, self-driving cars have been involved in accidents, and there's still a lot of debate around who's responsible when these accidents occur. There are also concerns around the safety and security of voice-activated assistants, which have been known to accidentally record private conversations.
https://akash.mittal.blog/web3/2023/6/1/ChatGPT-and-What-Parents-Should-Know-About-Burgeoning-AI-Technology.html
#trending #ChatGPT #Parents #AITechnology #Burgeoning

The rise of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) has brought a lot of excitement and potential to the world of digital assets. However, with this rise, there has also been concern about the use of NFTs for extremist purposes. Extremist groups have started using NFTs to further their agenda, and this has raised serious concerns about the impact of NFTs on society.
Recently, a group of extremist hackers created an NFT representing the infamous ISIS flag and sold it for thousands of dollars on the blockchain. The group claimed that the profits from the sale would be used to fund their activities. This incident is just one example of how extremist groups are using NFTs to fund and promote their agenda.
The concern with extremist NFTs is that they can be used to spread extremist ideologies and fund extremist activities. Extremist groups can use NFTs to raise funds anonymously, as the blockchain technology offers a high level of privacy. While the blockchain is a decentralized system that is transparent, it does not reveal the identity of the users. This means that extremist groups can use NFTs to fund their activities without revealing their identity.
Moreover, the use of NFTs can help extremist groups gain legitimacy. By creating NFTs that represent their ideology, extremist groups can legitimize their cause and gain support from people who share similar beliefs. The sale of extremist NFTs can also help these groups expand their reach and attract more followers to their cause.
The use of NFTs for extremist purposes is a growing concern. However, there are steps that can be taken to mitigate this risk:
https://akash.mittal.blog/web3/2023/6/1/Extremist-NFTs-Across-Blockchains-A-Growing-Concern.html
#trending #NFT #Extremism #Blockchain #Regulation #Collaboration #Education

His exciting journey into this new realm has taken the world by storm. In this article, we'll take a closer look at AB de Villiers' foray into Web3 and explore the potential of this exciting new technology.
AB de Villiers' love for cricket is well-known, having played for South Africa for more than a decade. However, after retiring from international cricket in 2018, he was looking for another challenge. That's when he discovered the world of cryptocurrency and its potential to revolutionize the world.
As a newcomer to the cryptocurrency scene, AB de Villiers turned to experts for guidance. He worked with top brokers and analysts to learn the ins and outs of trading and investing in cryptocurrency. Through his dedication and hard work, he quickly became an expert in his own right, and his investments soon began to pay off.
AB de Villiers' passion for the potential of cryptocurrency led him to the world of Web3. Web3, also known as the decentralized web, is a new way of thinking about the internet. It is a shift away from centralized systems, where a handful of companies control all the data and the flow of information, towards a more open and decentralized system, where everyone has a voice and can participate in the decision-making process.
AB de Villiers saw the potential of this new technology and quickly got involved. He started investing in Web3 projects and even began collaborating on some himself. He saw the potential of Web3 to revolutionize the world in the same way that the internet did in the 1990s.

Her parents became increasingly concerned about her physical and mental well-being. They visited their family doctor, but Emily denied any issues related to eating habits. One day, her mother came across an AI chatbot for National Eating Disorder Association. This was a turning point for Emily and her family, as they finally received the support they needed.

It's a beautiful day in New York City, and Sarah is out shopping with her friends. They stroll down Fifth Avenue, admiring the latest designer collections in the store windows. Sarah spots a glittering dress on display and rushes inside to try it on. The dress fits perfectly, and Sarah feels like a million dollars. But as she examines the price tag, she feels a pang of guilt.
She knows that the dress is made of cheap synthetic materials that are harmful to the environment. She knows that the factory workers who made the dress work under terrible conditions for meager pay. And she knows that the dress will end up in a landfill in a matter of months, contributing to the massive carbon footprint of the fashion industry.
Sarah's guilt is well-founded. The fashion industry is one of the most polluting industries in the world. It produces 10% of all carbon emissions and is responsible for massive amounts of waste and pollution. The rise of fast fashion, with its emphasis on producing cheap, disposable clothing at an unprecedented rate, has only exacerbated the problem.
Fast fashion brands like Zara, H&M, and Forever 21 produce hundreds of new collections every year, with each collection containing hundreds of new styles. These clothes are made of cheap materials and are designed to be worn only a few times before being discarded. The fast fashion model is unsustainable and is contributing to the environmental crisis we face today.
But there is hope for the fashion industry. Web3 technologies, such as blockchain and Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), could empower designers and consumers to create a more sustainable and ethical fashion industry.
https://akash.mittal.blog/web3/2023/6/1/How-Fast-Fashion-Obscures-Its-Carbon-Footprint-Behind-Web3-The-Metaverse.html
#trending #fastfashion #sustainability #Web3 #NFTs #fashion #environment

When I first heard about Web3, I thought it was just another trendy buzzword in the cryptocurrency and blockchain world. But as I dug deeper, I realized that Web3 is much more than that. It's a paradigm shift that is transforming the way we interact with the internet, and it has significant implications for the future of SEO.
Web3, also known as the decentralized web, is the next evolution of the internet. It's a new model that aims to create a more open, transparent, and decentralized web. Instead of relying on centralized servers and intermediaries, Web3 uses blockchain technology to allow for direct, peer-to-peer interactions between users.
This new model has many benefits. For one, it provides greater security and privacy for users. It also enables new types of applications and services that were not possible before. And perhaps most importantly, it puts control back in the hands of users, rather than large corporations.
As Web3 becomes more mainstream, it will have a significant impact on SEO. Here are just a few of the ways it will change the game:

Picture this: you're sitting at your desk, trying to finish up some work before you head home for the day. Suddenly, you remember that you need to stock up on groceries. You don't have the time or energy to physically go to the supermarket, but you also don't want to spend hours browsing an online shopping website looking for the items you need. What do you do?
Enter Instacart. The grocery delivery service has just introduced an innovative new feature called Ask Instacart ChatGPT, which is set to revolutionize the way we shop for groceries online.
Ask Instacart ChatGPT is an artificial intelligence-powered chatbot that is integrated into the Instacart app and website. It allows customers to ask a variety of questions related to their grocery shopping experience, from product recommendations to delivery times to refund policies. The chatbot uses natural language processing to understand and respond to customers in a conversational manner.
So, how does it work in practice? Let's say you're looking for a particular brand of cereal. You can simply type "Do you have Brand X cereal?" into the chatbot, and it will respond with a list of options and prices. Or, if you're not sure what kind of fruit to buy, you can ask "What's the best kind of fruit to get right now?" and the chatbot will offer some suggestions based on what's in season and what's popular.
The best part? Ask Instacart ChatGPT is available 24/7, so you can get instant answers to your questions at any time of day or night.

It was a beautiful morning in San Francisco, and the buzz of the tech industry was in the air. I was attending a conference on emerging technologies and AI, and I remember being nervous about the implications of the advancements being made. The speakers at the conference shared their insights on the potential benefits of AI, but the underlying message was clear " AI presented a threat of extinction on par with nuclear war.
It's a scary proposition to think that technology has the potential to wipe out human existence. But it's a real possibility that we must confront if we are to continue to push the boundaries of AI. According to Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla, "AI is a fundamental risk to the existence of human civilization."
The best way to illustrate the potential dangers of AI is by examining some quantifiable examples. One of the most significant dangers of AI is the potential for it to become smarter than humans. Once AI surpasses human intelligence, it will become extremely difficult to control it. This could result in catastrophic events such as the use of AI in military operations or the creation of autonomous robotic machines.
Another quantifiable example is the potential for AI to eliminate jobs. As AI becomes increasingly intelligent, it will be able to perform tasks that are currently performed by humans. This could lead to widespread unemployment, which in turn could result in social instability and unrest.
The rise of AI is a topic that has captured the attention of many, and for good reason. The potential benefits of AI are vast, but so too are the potential risks. The title of this article " "The Rise of AI: A Threat to Human Existence" " is both eye-catching and magnetic. It captures the dual nature of AI " both a tool for progress and a threat to our survival.

It was supposed to be the next big thing. The move from Web2 to Web3 was hailed as the dawn of a new era. But despite the hype, Web3's promised metropolis just isn't fun yet. This article takes a closer look at the current state of Web3 and why it fails to live up to its promises.
When I first heard about Web3, I was excited. The idea of a decentralized web that puts users in control of their data and removes the need for middlemen sounded like a no-brainer.
But my excitement quickly turned to disappointment when I tried to use some of the dApps that are supposed to represent the future of Web3. The user experience was clunky, slow, and frustrating. The promise of decentralization was there, but at what cost?
According to DappRadar, the most popular dApps on the Ethereum blockchain are still dominated by gambling apps and decentralized exchanges. These might be interesting use cases, but they hardly represent the transformative potential of Web3. And even these "popular" dApps only have a few thousand daily active users.
Meanwhile, the cost of using some of these dApps has skyrocketed due to Ethereum's congestion and high gas fees. Users are being priced out of the network, and there's little incentive for developers to create new dApps when there's such a limited userbase.
https://akash.mittal.blog/web3/2023/6/1/Web3-s-Promised-Metropolis-Just-Isn-t-Fun-Yet.html

"I don't have time to read all those legal precedents and cases. I need the brief done in three hours," said one client to his attorney.
Every lawyer has heard this request at one time or another. With constant time pressures, some attorneys look for shortcuts to help them get the job done. But is using an AI writing tool like ChatGPT the answer?
Recently a lawyer was busted for using ChatGPT to write a brief for a client. The AI tool had cited cases that didn't exist in legal systems, made up facts, and even created fake organizations. The brief was full of errors, yet the lawyer was still going to submit it to the court.
That lawyer is now being investigated for malpractice. And it's a wake-up call for all attorneys to consider the ethical implications of using digital tools in legal writing.
ChatGPT is a highly advanced AI writing tool that can generate text on any topic with human-like quality. With the rise of tools like ChatGPT, lawyers now have access to an abundance of information and resources that can help them write better briefs, contracts, and legal documents.
https://akash.mittal.blog/web3/2023/6/1/When-Cheating-Meets-Technology-The-Rise-and-Fall-of-ChatGPT-in-Legal-Writing.html

Imagine you are playing an online game and suddenly you are asked to create an account with a third-party service to use some in-game features. You are hesitant but decide to do it anyway. Next thing you know, you receive an email saying that your account has been hacked and all your progress has been lost. This is just one of the dangers of integrating Web3 with an actual game.
The idea of integrating Web3 with an actual game is to bring in more players and allow them to use cryptocurrency for in-game purchases. Sounds great, right? However, the reality is that integrating Web3 can actually harm the game and its players.
To avoid these problems, Web3 should be kept separate from the actual game.
One example of a game that successfully separated Web3 from the actual game is Gods Unchained. They use a third-party service called Metamask for cryptocurrency payments, ensuring that the game remains secure. They also provide education for players through tutorials and a separate website that explains the blockchain technology in detail.
Another example is Splinterlands, an online trading card game that uses blockchain technology for provable fairness and transparency. However, they kept Web3 separate from the actual game, using a third-party service called Hive to handle cryptocurrency payments.
https://akash.mittal.blog/web3/2023/6/1/Why-Web3-Should-Be-Separated-from-the-Actual-Game.html
#trending #Web3GameDevelopment #BlockchainGaming #OnlineGameSecurity #ThirdPartyServices
